Firmata

Firmata

The Board object represents an arduino board.

Constructor

new Firmata(port, function)

Properties:
Name Type Description
MODES

All the modes available for pins on this arduino board.
I2C_MODES

All the I2C modes available.
SERIAL_MODES

All the Serial modes available.
SERIAL_PORT_ID

ID values to pass as the portId parameter when calling serialConfig.
HIGH

A constant to set a pins value to HIGH when the pin is set to an output.
LOW

A constant to set a pins value to LOW when the pin is set to an output.
pins

An array of pin object literals.
analogPins

An array of analog pins and their corresponding indexes in the pins array.
version

An object indicating the major and minor version of the firmware currently running.
firmware

An object indicating the name, major and minor version of the firmware currently running.
buffer

An array holding the current bytes received from the arduino.
sp SerialPort

The serial port object used to communicate with the arduino.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
port String

This is the serial port the arduino is connected to.
function function

A function to be called when the arduino is ready to communicate.

Extends

  • EventEmitter

Methods

(static) isAcceptablePort() → {Boolean}

Firmata.isAcceptablePort Determines if a port object (from SerialPort.list()) is a valid Arduino (or similar) device.

Returns:

true if port can be connected to by Firmata

Type
Boolean

accelStepperAcceleration(deviceNum, acceleration)

Asks the arduino to set the acceleration for a stepper

Parameters:
Name Type Description
deviceNum number

Device number for the stepper (range 0-9)
acceleration number

Desired acceleration in steps per sec^2

accelStepperConfig(opts)

Asks the arduino to configure a stepper motor with the given config to allow asynchronous control of the stepper

Parameters:
Name Type Description
opts object

Options: {number} deviceNum: Device number for the stepper (range 0-9) {number} type: One of this.STEPPER.TYPE.* {number} stepSize: One of this.STEPPER.STEP_SIZE.* {number} stepPin: Only used if STEPPER.TYPE.DRIVER {number} directionPin: Only used if STEPPER.TYPE.DRIVER {number} motorPin1: motor pin 1 {number} motorPin2: motor pin 2 {number} [motorPin3]: Only required if type == this.STEPPER.TYPE.THREE_WIRE || this.STEPPER.TYPE.FOUR_WIRE {number} [motorPin4]: Only required if type == this.STEPPER.TYPE.FOUR_WIRE {number} [enablePin]: Enable pin {array} [invertPins]: Array of pins to invert

accelStepperEnable(deviceNum, enabledopt)

Asks the arduino to enable/disable a stepper

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
deviceNum number

Device number for the stepper (range 0-9)
enabled boolean <optional>
 true

accelStepperReportPosition(deviceNum)

Asks the arduino to report the position of a stepper

Parameters:
Name Type Description
deviceNum number

Device number for the stepper (range 0-9)

accelStepperSpeed(deviceNum, speed, callbackopt)

Asks the arduino to set the max speed for a stepper

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
deviceNum number

Device number for the stepper (range 0-9)
speed number

Desired speed or maxSpeed in steps per second
callback function <optional>

accelStepperStep(deviceNum, steps, callback)

Asks the arduino to move a stepper a number of steps (and optionally with and acceleration and deceleration) speed is in units of steps/sec

Parameters:
Name Type Description
deviceNum number

Device number for the stepper (range 0-5)
steps number

Number of steps to make
callback function

A function to call when stepper done move.

accelStepperStop(deviceNum)

Asks the arduino to stop a stepper

Parameters:
Name Type Description
deviceNum number

Device number for the stepper (range 0-9)

accelStepperTo(deviceNum, position, callback)

Asks the arduino to move a stepper to a specific location

Parameters:
Name Type Description
deviceNum number

Device number for the stepper (range 0-5)
position number

Desired position
callback function

A function to call when stepper done move.

accelStepperZero(deviceNum)

Asks the arduino to set the stepper position to 0 Note: This is not a move. We are setting the current position equal to zero

Parameters:
Name Type Description
deviceNum number

Device number for the stepper (range 0-9)

analogRead(pin, callback)

Asks the arduino to read analog data. Turn on reporting for this pin.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
pin number

The pin to read analog data
callback function

A function to call when we have the analag data.

digitalRead(pin, callback)

Asks the arduino to read digital data. Turn on reporting for this pin's port.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
pin number

The pin to read data from
callback function

The function to call when data has been received

digitalWrite(pin, value, enqueue)

Asks the arduino to write a value to a digital pin

Parameters:
Name Type Description
pin number

The pin you want to write a value to.
value number

The value you want to write. Must be board.HIGH or board.LOW
enqueue boolean

When true, the local state is updated but the command is not sent to the Arduino

flushDigitalPorts()

Write queued digital ports

Returns:

i2cConfig(delay, with)

Enable I2C with an optional read delay. Must be called before an I2C Read or Write

Supersedes sendI2CConfig

Parameters:
Name Type Description
delay number

in microseconds to set for I2C Read

or
with object

a single property delay

i2cRead(address, register, numBytes, callback)

Initialize a continuous I2C read.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
address number

The address of the I2C device
register number

Optionally set the register to read from.
numBytes number

The number of bytes to receive.
callback function

A function to call when we have received the bytes.

i2cReadOnce(address, register, numBytes, callback)

Perform a single I2C read

Supersedes sendI2CReadRequest

Read bytes from address

Parameters:
Name Type Description
address number

The address of the I2C device
register number

Optionally set the register to read from.
numBytes number

The number of bytes to receive.
callback function

A function to call when we have received the bytes.

i2cStop(options, address)

Stop continuous reading of the specified I2C address or register.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
options object

Options: bus {number} The I2C bus (on supported platforms) address {number} The I2C peripheral address to stop reading.
address number

The I2C peripheral address to stop reading.

sendI2CConfig(delay)

Sends a I2C config request to the arduino board with an optional value in microseconds to delay an I2C Read. Must be called before an I2C Read or Write

Parameters:
Name Type Description
delay number

in microseconds to set for I2C Read

Parameters:
Name Type Description

The address of the I2C device

The number of bytes to receive.

A function to call when we have received the bytes.

sendOneWireAlarmsSearch(pin, callback)

Searches for 1-wire devices on the bus in an alarmed state. The passed callback should accept and error argument and an array of device identifiers.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
pin
callback

sendOneWireConfig(pin, enableParasiticPower)

Configure the passed pin as the controller in a 1-wire bus. Pass as enableParasiticPower true if you want the data pin to power the bus.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
pin
enableParasiticPower

sendOneWireDelay(pin)

Tells firmata to not do anything for the passed amount of ms. For when you need to give a device attached to the bus time to do a calculation.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
pin

sendOneWireRead(pin, device, numBytesToRead, callback)

Reads data from a device on the bus and invokes the passed callback.

N.b. ConfigurableFirmata will issue the 1-wire select command internally.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
pin
device
numBytesToRead
callback

sendOneWireReset(pin)

Resets all devices on the bus.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
pin

sendOneWireSearch(pin, callback)

Searches for 1-wire devices on the bus. The passed callback should accept and error argument and an array of device identifiers.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
pin
callback

sendOneWireWrite(pin, device, data)

Writes data to the bus to be received by the passed device. The device should be obtained from a previous call to sendOneWireSearch.

N.b. ConfigurableFirmata will issue the 1-wire select command internally.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
pin
device
data

sendOneWireWriteAndRead(pin, device, data, numBytesToRead, callback)

Sends the passed data to the passed device on the bus, reads the specified number of bytes and invokes the passed callback.

N.b. ConfigurableFirmata will issue the 1-wire select command internally.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
pin
device
data
numBytesToRead
callback

serialConfig(options)

Asks the Arduino to configure a hardware or serial port.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
options object

Options: portId {number} The serial port to use (HW_SERIAL1, HW_SERIAL2, HW_SERIAL3, SW_SERIAL0, SW_SERIAL1, SW_SERIAL2, SW_SERIAL3) baud {number} The baud rate of the serial port rxPin {number} [SW Serial only] The RX pin of the SoftwareSerial instance txPin {number} [SW Serial only] The TX pin of the SoftwareSerial instance

Set a pin to SERVO mode with an explicit PWM range.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
pin number

The pin the servo is connected to
min number

A 14-bit signed int.
max number

A 14-bit signed int.

Asks the arduino to move a servo

Parameters:
Name Type Description
pin number

The pin the servo is connected to

setSamplingInterval(interval)

Set sampling interval in millis. Default is 19 ms

Parameters:
Name Type Description
interval number

The sampling interval in ms > 10

stepperConfig(deviceNum, type, stepsPerRev, stepOrMotor1Pin, dirOrMotor2Pin, motorPin3opt, motorPin4opt)

Asks the arduino to configure a stepper motor with the given config to allow asynchronous control of the stepper

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
deviceNum number

Device number for the stepper (range 0-5, expects steppers to be setup in order from 0 to 5)
type number

One of this.STEPPER.TYPE.*
stepsPerRev number

Number of steps motor takes to make one revolution
stepOrMotor1Pin number

If using EasyDriver type stepper driver, this is direction pin, otherwise it is motor 1 pin
dirOrMotor2Pin number

If using EasyDriver type stepper driver, this is step pin, otherwise it is motor 2 pin
motorPin3 number <optional>

Only required if type == this.STEPPER.TYPE.FOUR_WIRE
motorPin4 number <optional>

Only required if type == this.STEPPER.TYPE.FOUR_WIRE

stepperStep(deviceNum, direction, steps, speed, accel, decelopt, callbackopt)

Asks the arduino to move a stepper a number of steps at a specific speed (and optionally with and acceleration and deceleration) speed is in units of .01 rad/sec accel and decel are in units of .01 rad/sec^2 TODO: verify the units of speed, accel, and decel

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
deviceNum number

Device number for the stepper (range 0-5)
direction number

One of this.STEPPER.DIRECTION.*
steps number

Number of steps to make
speed number
accel number | function

Acceleration or if accel and decel are not used, then it can be the callback
decel number <optional>
callback function <optional>

sysexCommand(message)

Allow user code to send arbitrary sysex messages

Parameters:
Name Type Description
message Array

The message array is expected to be all necessary bytes between START_SYSEX and END_SYSEX (non-inclusive). It will be assumed that the data in the message array is already encoded as 2 7-bit bytes LSB first.

sysexResponse(commandByte, handler)

Allow user code to handle arbitrary sysex responses

Parameters:
Name Type Description
commandByte number

The commandByte must be associated with some message that's expected from the slave device. The handler is called with an array of raw data from the slave. Data decoding must be done within the handler itself.

                        Use Firmata.decode(data) to extract useful values from
                        the incoming response data.
handler function

Function which handles receipt of responses matching commandByte.

updateDigitalPort(pin, value)

Update local store of digital port state

Parameters:
Name Type Description
pin number

The pin you want to write a value to.
value number

The value you want to write. Must be board.HIGH or board.LOW

writeDigitalPort(port)

Update a digital port (group of 8 digital pins) on the Arduino

Parameters:
Name Type Description
port number

The port you want to update.
